Roma - Auge y caída World-wide (Spanish title)

1.title: The First Barbarian War

episode of.title: Rome: Rise and Fall of an Empire (TV Series 2008– )

1.plot: It is 113 BC. The Cimbri smash through the northern imperial border to threaten Rome. Gripped by terror, Rome turns to General Marius, who will transform the Roman army and shake the Republic's political foundations to the core.

2.title: Spartacus

episode of.title: Rome: Rise and Fall of an Empire (TV Series 2008– )

2.plot: When Roman generals Pompey and Crassus lead their mighty legions of soldiers and mercenaries into the lands surrounding Italy, neither anticipates the turmoil caused by one bold mercenary.

3.title: Julius Cesar

episode of.title: Rome: Rise and Fall of an Empire (TV Series 2008– )

3.plot: Julius Caesar attempts to annex Gaul and build his reputation while the empire churns with civil war.

4.title: The Forest of Death

episode of.title: Rome: Rise and Fall of an Empire (TV Series 2008– )

4.plot: As the Roman Empire expands its reach into what is now Germany, its legions are faced with ferocious Germanic tribesmen.

5.title: The Invasion of Britain

episode of.title: Rome: Rise and Fall of an Empire (TV Series 2008– )

5.plot: It is 47 A.D. The new emperor Claudius is considered by many to be the village idiot. He can only hang onto his throne by waging a spectacular conquest.

6.title: The Dacian Wars

episode of.title: Rome: Rise and Fall of an Empire (TV Series 2008– )

6.plot: Despite many successes, the multitude of military campaigns begin to take their toll on Rome's finances.

7.title: Rebellion and Betrayal

episode of.title: Rome: Rise and Fall of an Empire (TV Series 2008– )

7.plot: Marcus Aurelius inherits the empire at its peak. The imperial boundaries stretch from the Irish Sea to the sands of Syria. But the greater Rome grows, the bigger a target she becomes.

8.title: Wrath of the Gods

episode of.title: Rome: Rise and Fall of an Empire (TV Series 2008– )

8.plot: In the beginning of the 3rd century, Rome is in crisis. Ravaged by civil war and foreign invasions, it now faces an even greater challenge in the new religion of Christianity.

9.title: The Soldiers' Emperor

episode of.title: Rome: Rise and Fall of an Empire (TV Series 2008– )

9.plot: Near the end of the 3rd century, civil war has torn the empire apart and left its borders vulnerable to barbarian invasion. Romans living on the eastern and western frontiers, far from Rome, are left to defend themselves.

10.title: Constantine

episode of.title: Rome: Rise and Fall of an Empire (TV Series 2008– )

10.plot: The civil wars of the 3rd century are finally ended by Emperor Diocletian. In the eastern court and army of this powerful emperor, a young Constantine receives the training of a future leader.

11.title: The Barbarian General

episode of.title: Rome: Rise and Fall of an Empire (TV Series 2008– )

11.plot: By the end of the 4th century, Romans and barbarians live together uneasily, a situation that often explodes into violence. When Emperor Theodosius enlists the Goths as mercenaries, he relies on his trusted general to lead.

12.title: The Puppet Master

episode of.title: Rome: Rise and Fall of an Empire (TV Series 2008– )

12.plot: In 450 A.D., Rome is a mere shadow of its former self. Now, Roman rulers are at the mercy of their barbarian invaders, offering them power and territory in exchange for peace.

13.title: The Last Emperor

episode of.title: Rome: Rise and Fall of an Empire (TV Series 2008– )

13.plot: In the middle of the 5th century, as the Empire fights a losing battle against its formidable barbarian opponents, one Roman named Orestes finds service in the court of Attila the Hun.

imdb.plot outline: A thirteen hour series which focuses on the Germanic, Britannic and other barbarian tribal wars with Rome which ultimately led to the decline and fall of the Roman Empire. This series is centered on the campaigns and battles with the barbarian tribes and extensive examinations of the reigns of little known Roman emperors and generals. The significance and structures of key barbarian tribes and the roles their leaders played are explored in detail. Territorial changes to the Roman Empire caused by unrelenting wars, plagues, mass starvation's and power struggles are presented in chronological historical context with extensive re-enactments. This series examines how the continuous wars with the barbarians and depletion of resources became a core cause of the Roman Empire's decline and eventual collapse.
